intro: Isolepis heterolepis, commonly known as the variable spike-rush, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to wetland habitats in North America. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes grass-like plants known as sedges. The plant features grass-like leaves and produces dense, cylindrical clusters of small, spike-like flowers. It thrives in moist to aquatic environments, often found in marshes and along the edges of ponds. Its ecological importance lies in providing habitat and food for various aquatic and terrestrial organisms.
